Rate control versus rhythm control
Several clinical trials27, 28, 29, 30 comparing the strategies of rhythm control with rate control for atrial fibrillation, as well as meta-analyses,31, 32, 33, 34 have shown no significant differences between the two strategies with respect to mortality, major bleeding, and thromboembolic events, at least on an intention-to-treat analysis.
